title: Add post-presale listings section ("Listings after the presale")

requirements.text: Add a new landing-page section that communicates the projectâ€™s planned token listings after the presale, using English user-facing text and matching the existing neon/glow visual style.
acceptanceCriteria: A new section is visible on the page with a clear heading such as "Listings After the Presale".
All text in the new section is in English.
The section styling is consistent with existing sections (same container widths, card styling, neon accents, readable contrast).

requirements.text: Make the new listings section react to presale state: when the presale is still active, show a clear "not yet" message; when the presale has ended, show the actual listings content.
acceptanceCriteria: When presale status indicates active=true, the listings section displays an English message indicating listings will be announced after the presale ends.
When presale status indicates active=false, the listings section displays the post-presale listings content.
The page remains usable if presale status data is temporarily unavailable (no rendering crash; show a short English fallback message).

requirements.text: Integrate the listings section into the existing page flow by rendering it in App.tsx as a new section below the current Tokenomics/FAQ section and above the Footer, without altering existing section behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: The listings section renders below Tokenomics & FAQ and above the Footer in the single-page layout.
No existing sections are removed or reordered (beyond inserting this new section).
Build passes and the app loads without console errors related to the new section.

requirements.text: Define the listings content as a small, editable data structure (e.g., a typed constant list) so future exchange/listing items can be updated without rewriting JSX, and render it as cards with a status indicator (e.g., Planned / In Progress / Announced).
acceptanceCriteria: Listings items are driven from a centralized data structure (not hard-coded repeatedly in markup).
Each listing item renders a title and a status label.
No specific real-world exchanges are claimed by default unless explicitly provided later.

constraints: Use English for any user-facing text.
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or other immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (no additional canisters/services).
nonGoals: Do not implement real exchange integrations, APIs, or automatic listing submissions.
Do not change presale accounting, deposit address logic, or contribution tracking as part of this request.
Do not add authentication or gated access for viewing listings content.
